How do fees generated through cross-chain fee conversions or liquidity pool usage benefit the new blockchain?

Fees generated through cross-chain fee conversions or liquidity pool usage are earned on the new blockchain, with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain. This means that the new blockchain benefits directly from these fees, without having to share them with the Verus blockchain.

in, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs of proceeds, and pre-launch discounts for early participants. Using VerusIDs, launches can also include vesting schedules in the pre-allocations as well.
## An interoperable, multichain network for new use cases and unlimited scale**
- The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network allows the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains in the Verus network. Notary IDs, specified at chain definition, provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation, enabling public blockchains available to the world for merge mining and staking, as well as private, internal blockchains, which are easy to setup with easy bridging of public currencies into an organization and onto their internal private network and back, with all features and currencies of the public chain but none of the access. There is no limit on the number of blockchains that may continuously operate and interoperate on the Verus network. What happens if a blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launch does not meet the minimum participation levels?

If a blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launch does not meet the minimum participation levels by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically receive a refund of their pre-conversions, minus network fees. This ensures that participants are protected in case the launch is not successful.

What features are available for blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches on Verus?

Verus provides several features for blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches, including:

* Minimum participation levels in preferred currencies
* Automatic refunds if minimum participation levels are not met
* Maximum participation limits in one or more currencies
* Pre-launch discounts
* Price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs
* Vesting schedules for pre-allocations
* Price-neutral carve-outs of proceeds

These features provide a high degree of flexibility and customization for launching new currencies on the Verus network.

What is the Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network, and what are its benefits?

The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network is a decentralized network that allows for the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains. This network enables the creation of public and private blockchains, which can be used for various use cases and can scale indefinitely. The benefits of this network include:

* Unlimited scalability
* Interoperability between blockchains
* Decentralized bridge confirmation using Notary IDs
* Easy setup of private, internal blockchains
* Seamless bridging of public currencies into private networks

This network provides a flexible and scalable infrastructure for building blockchain-based applications on Verus.
